intro: Pothuava pineliana, commonly known as the Pinel's pothuava, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or under dense canopy cover. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
